page.title: 14CRANHAM PLACE: UPMINSTER
page.content: Cranham Place is situated close to the M25 motorway in the parish of{North {Ockendon.}It was originally a Manor, consisting of{a house, a barn, & a {stable.}The Manor House was destroyed in a fire fifteen years ago & was rebuilt as flats subsequently. The barn next to the House has been restored & converted into a bungalow whereas the stables have been made into a detached house. Mr. Efferson the current owner rents out all these premises. Previously they were owned jointly by Mr. Knight & Mr. Huelston. The area surrounding Cranham Place has had its fair share of disasters. Nearby Manor Church was bombed during the war but survived the blast.
